summary:
Golden Retrievers are medium-sized dogs from Scotland known for their friendly and loving personalities and beautiful golden fur. They were bred to work, helping hunters fetch game. These dogs are popular pets and often participate in dog shows or work as guide dogs.

The breed was created by Sir Dudley Marjoribanks in the 1800s by mixing several dog breeds. He wanted to make a great hunting dog. Golden Retrievers were officially recognized in 1913 and soon became popular worldwide.
title: Golden Retriever
